courseDetails.title: Mastering Data Magic : Power BI + Tableau  + SQL , Analytics
courseDetails.shortDescription: Data Analytics with Power BI , Tableau and SQL
courseDetails.longDescription:
1. Data Analytics: Data analytics is the process of examining, cleaning, transforming, and interpreting data to extract meaningful insights, patterns, and trends. It helps organizations make informed decisions and improve their business performance by leveraging data.

  2. Why Data Analytics: Data analytics is crucial for businesses to make data-driven decisions. It enables organizations to:

    • Identify trends and opportunities.

    • Improve operational efficiency.

    • Enhance customer experience.

    • Make informed strategic decisions.

    • Predict future outcomes.

  3. Types of Data Analytics: There are four main types of data analytics:

    • Descriptive Analytics: Summarizes historical data to provide insights.

    • Diagnostic Analytics: Analyzes data to understand why certain events occurred.

    • Predictive Analytics: Uses historical data to predict future outcomes.

    • Prescriptive Analytics: Recommends actions based on predictive analytics.

  4. Steps Involved in Data Analytics: The typical steps in data analytics include data collection, data cleaning, data exploration, data modeling, data visualization, and interpretation of results.

  5. Tools for Data Analytics: There are various tools for data analytics, including Power BI, Tableau, Excel, Python (with libraries like Pandas and Matplotlib), R, and more.

  6. Skills for Data Analytics: To excel in data analytics, you should have skills in data manipulation, statistical analysis, data visualization, domain knowledge, and problem-solving. Soft skills like communication and teamwork are also essential.

  7. Downloading and Installing Power BI Desktop: You can download Power BI Desktop from the official Microsoft website. After downloading, run the installer and follow the installation instructions.

  8. Understanding Interface, Options, and Settings: Power BI Desktop has a user-friendly interface with options and settings to customize your workspace, data sources, and report layouts.

  9. Data Source and Uploading Sample Data: You can connect Power BI to various data sources, such as databases, Excel files, and web services. You can also import sample data to practice.

  10. Understanding Data and Basic Data Types: In Power BI, you must understand your data's structure, data types (e.g., text, numbers, dates), and how to clean and transform it for analysis.

  11. Building Charts: Power BI allows you to create various visualizations, including bar charts, line charts, pie charts, and more, to represent your data effectively.

  12. Visual Interactions: You can set up interactions between visuals to create dynamic reports where selecting one visual influences others.

  13. Formatting: You can format visuals, fonts, colors, and backgrounds to make your reports visually appealing and easier to understand.

  14. Web Scraping: Power BI can extract data from websites using web scraping techniques, allowing you to incorporate external data sources.

  15. Data Modeling: You can create relationships between tables, define measures, and build a data model for accurate analysis and reporting.

  16. RDBMS Introduction: Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) like SQL Server, MySQL, and Oracle can be connected to Power BI to fetch data.

  17. Map Visualization: Power BI supports mapping visualizations to display data geospatially, making it useful for location-based analysis.

  18. Saving Power BI Files: You can save your Power BI reports as .pbix files, which can be shared and opened by others using Power BI Desktop.

  19. Scatter Plot and Other Features: Scatter plots are useful for visualizing the relationship between two numeric variables. Power BI also offers many other features like filtering, drill-through, and custom visuals.

  20. Conditional Formatting: You can apply conditional formatting to visuals to highlight specific data points based on predefined rules.

  21. Hiding Tables in Report View: You can hide tables or fields that you don't want to display in the report view to declutter your workspace.

  22. Grouping, Bar Charts, Column Charts, Ribbon Charts, Small Multiples: These are various visualization types that you can create in Power BI to represent your data in different ways, such as grouping data, using bar or column charts, ribbon charts, and displaying small multiples for comparative analysis.

Power BI is a powerful tool for data analytics, and mastering these topics will help you create informative and visually appealing reports for data-driven decision-making.
targetAudiences: This course is designed for data enthusiasts, analysts, business professionals, and anyone looking to harness the power of Power BI for in-depth data analysis and visualization.

Social Media Marketing (SMM):

Social Media Marketing is a form of digital marketing that utilizes social media platforms to promote products, services, or brands. It involves creating and sharing content on social media networks to engage with a target audience, increase brand awareness, and drive website traffic. SMM encompasses various activities such as posting text and image updates, videos, and other content that sparks user engagement.


Social Media Management:

Social Media Management involves the strategic planning, monitoring, and execution of a company's social media marketing efforts. It includes tasks like creating content calendars, responding to comments and messages, analyzing performance metrics, and adjusting strategies based on data.


Why Social Media Marketing Matters

Social media marketing offers numerous advantages for businesses of all sizes and across all industries. Here are some key benefits:

  • Increased Brand Awareness: Social media platforms provide a powerful tool to reach a wider audience and establish your brand identity. By consistently sharing valuable content and engaging with your followers, you can build brand recognition and create a positive brand image.

  • Enhanced Customer Engagement: Social media fosters two-way communication, allowing you to connect with your customers directly. You can address their questions and concerns, build relationships, and foster brand loyalty.

  • Lead Generation and Sales Growth: Social media campaigns can generate leads by attracting potential customers and directing them to your website or landing pages. You can leverage targeted advertising and calls to action to convert leads into paying customers.

  • Market Research and Insights: Social media listening tools allow you to track brand mentions, analyze audience demographics and interests, and gain valuable insights into customer sentiment. This information can be used to refine your marketing strategies and tailor content to resonate better with your target audience.

  • Improved Brand Reputation Management: Social media allows you to proactively manage your brand reputation by addressing negative feedback promptly and showcasing positive customer experiences.


Importance for Companies and Managers:


Enhanced Communication:

Social media marketing and management skills enable companies to communicate directly with their audience, fostering brand loyalty and customer satisfaction.


Brand Building:

Social media is a powerful tool for brand building. Effective SMM can enhance brand visibility and reputation, leading to increased trust and credibility.


Customer Engagement:

Social media management allows companies to engage with their audience in real-time, addressing concerns, gathering feedback, and building a community around the brand.


Marketing Effectiveness:

Social media platforms provide targeted advertising options. Knowing how to leverage these tools through SMM enhances the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.


Career Development and Business Success:


Versatility:

Learning social media marketing, management, equips professionals with versatile skills applicable across various industries and roles.


Competitive Edge:

Professionals who master these skills have a competitive advantage in the job market. Companies value employees who can effectively communicate, market products, and manage social media presence.


Entrepreneurial Success:

For entrepreneurs, these skills are crucial for establishing and promoting their own businesses. Effective communication and marketing strategies can significantly contribute to business success.


Adaptability:

In a rapidly evolving digital landscape, individuals who continuously enhance their skills in these areas demonstrate adaptability and are better positioned for career growth and business development.


The solid understanding of social media marketing, management and business writing is invaluable for companies and managers. It not only facilitates effective communication but also contributes to brand building, marketing success, and overall career development. In the dynamic business environment, these skills are instrumental in staying competitive and achieving long-term success.
targetAudiences: For anybody who want to build career at Marketing, Public Relations and Advertising

courseDetails.title: OSINT: Content Discovery
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn how to scan webservers
courseDetails.longDescription:
OSINT (open-source intelligence) is not a single topic. It is, in short, open-source intelligence. OSINT is as old as the internet and goes by many names including intelligence gathering (IG), information gathering (IG).

The same techniques have been used by network administrators to monitor network traffic and detect intrusions, by social media analysts to monitor hashtags and topics on Twitter, in the military to monitor potential adversaries, and in marketing to monitor competitors.

In this course we'll focus on web servers. You will learn how to find hidden directories and files on any web server or website. You'll learn how to get access to older versions of a website, about web technologies, how to view HTTP headers and how to do automated scans.

Hackers will do content discovery as part of their hacking process, if they find a web server is running. From there, they may find out ways to exploit the scripts (php, node), find documents and more.

This is a beginners course, you don't need any prior knowledge. But, you should have Kali Linux at hands. Kali Linux is a free system designed for Cyber Security and Ethical Hacking, it has around 600 hacking programs. The easiest way to start it is from a USB disk or inside Virtual Box.
targetAudiences: Beginner Ethical Hackers
Software Developers
Detectives
Investigators

courseDetails.title: Windows Command Line (cmd) and Batch Script Management
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn common commands used on a Windows command line (cmd) prompt and automate Windows command line (cmd) tasks
courseDetails.longDescription:
One of the many tools that administrators use on a daily basis is the Windows Command Line (cmd) / Prompt. Over this course, you'll learn the following skills, which are often used in the real world by computer technicians:


* How to create, rename, move and delete files and directories within the Windows operating system using the command line.

* The different types of file systems and how to navigate between directories using the cmd prompt.

* Setting the date and time on your PC using the date, time and tzutil commands

* Managing and formatting disk drives using the Diskpart command

* Shutting down, restarting and logging off your machine

* Viewing and applying group policy information using the Gpupdate and Gpresult commands, which can often be useful when troubleshooting conflicting group policies.

* Creating cmd batch files and some of the most common commands used within them, which can often save time when dealing with repetitive tasks.

* How to access system information contained within the Windows Management Instrumentation database (WMI) information using the WMIC command and sub-commands.


Whilst there are some differences between versions of Windows, a lot of these commands haven't changed since Windows 2000, meaning that any prior knowledge of this subject, while not essential by any means, would be advantageous at any stage of your IT career.
targetAudiences: IT Professionals wanting to learn more about the Windows command prompt

If you often find yourself struggling to understand or use common English expressions in conversations, this course is for you. In this practical and engaging course by Tango Lingo, you’ll master essential English idioms that are widely used in professional and everyday communication.

Idioms are the secret weapon to sounding like a native speaker. They add color, emotion, and impact to your speech and writing. Whether you're participating in business meetings, writing professional emails, chatting with friends, or networking at events, idioms will make your English more authentic and engaging.


What you’ll learn:

  • Learn how to integrate idioms smoothly into your speech and writing, making you sound more natural and confident.

  • Boost your English fluency and comprehension by learning idioms in context with practical examples and real-life scenarios.

By the end of this course, you’ll no longer hesitate when you hear or want to use idioms in conversations. Instead, you’ll be ready to apply them effectively to stand out and connect better with native and non-native English speakers alike.


Why take this course?

  • Business professionals who need to sound more polished and confident in the workplace.

  • Students and travelers who wish to navigate English-speaking environments with ease.

We believe learning English should be fun, interactive, and practical. Our step-by-step approach helps you fully understand each idiom, while exercises and real-life examples ensure you can apply them right away.

Join us at Tango Lingo and start speaking English the way it’s really used!
